VISION

Past, present, future

01.
HISTORY

Info Tech’s roots run deep focusing on statistical and economic consulting services, which led to the development of the first computerized methods for detecting collusive behavior in sealed bid markets. This advancement paved the way for the Info Tech Systems business to continue to use technology today to solve problems addressed by clients in the infrastructure construction industry.

Initially, Info Tech Systems began by helping state Department of Transportations (DOTs) manage infrastructure construction projects from estimation through construction completion. Through our partnership with the American Association of State Highway and Transportation Officials (AASHTO) and our services surrounding AASHTOWare Project™, we created a market in infrastructure construction that introduced technology to manage information, hence “Info Tech.”This remained our core business through the 1990s.

Previous Next

While focusing on our niche position with DOT’s, our customer base grew by offering products such as Expedite, Estimator and the Bid Express® service. These products were built with a DOT focus but also for use by contractors, consultants and suppliers. Our products began to serve those responsible for delivering the value promised to DOTs on their projects. This expansion allowed Info Tech Systems to serve both owners and consultants/contractors, providing products that facilitate secure data and information exchange through technology. Into the 2000s our focus was on building more of these products which led to the development of our core ITI Products - the Appia® service, an additional Bid Express® service and later the Doc Express® service. These products were applications of core competencies gained through our work with DOT’s but targeted towards local government agencies and other owners of infrastructure projects and assets.

Throughout our history, our value proposition has been our ability to build trust and establish relationships with our customers while leveraging our understanding of government agencies. Because we understand their culture, needs and methodologies, we have been able to develop products and offer extraordinary service and measurable results that exceed their needs. In the process, we gained a distinct market foothold. As we look forward, due to limited government funding and a trend toward privatization, the government owner role in construction projects is changing. This shift drives a clear direction in our growth strategy.

03.
THE NEXT FIVE YEARS

Info Tech Systems will continue to build on the owner-centered core fundamental to our current strength and sustainability while vigorously developing new markets, customers, products and services. We will focus on building technology and systems that support information exchange between owners, contractors and consultants, paying attention to evolving sector dynamics (e.g. funding shifts, contracting models, growing verticals, owner roles), understanding technology advancements (e.g. drones, LIDAR, electric and autonomous vehicles, artificial intelligence, IoT), and leveraging user-centered design to anticipate and develop a product ecosystem for customers that ensures value promised is value delivered.

Remaining the infrastructure construction market leader for owners through our partnership with AASHTO, we will pivot ITI Products’ core customer focus to contractors and consultants, providing them with the technology and tools needed to manage information and serve owners. We will continue to cultivate our relationship with AASHTO to support AASHTOWare Project and identify and offer holistic product support and strategic services to owner agencies. Simultaneously, our strategic plan opens new roads for ITI Products to provide a complete workflow solution for the infrastructure construction ecosystem that will drive revenue and growth.

04.
EXECUTING THE STRATEGIC PLAN

Info Tech Systems will set the standards in the industry while we explore new markets, customers, products and services. And as we make advancements toward achieving our goals, one thing will remain: we will remain customer focused.

Over the next five years, we will invest in:

These investments will lead to:

  1. Customer retention and growth
  2. Sales and revenue growth
  3. Innovation and talent engagement
  4. Market and thought leadership

As we execute our five-year strategic plan, Info Tech Systems will focus on long-term growth with a sustainable competitive advantage while staying true to our people-centric culture. Our products make things easier for those who build, operate and maintain the United States’ infrastructure - and we don’t take that lightly. As our focus expands to new markets and customers, we will not waiver from our priority of ensuring value promised is value delivered.
